newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Slovak bank to reveal 1996 results Friday.
newsitem.headline: Slovak bank to reveal 1996 results Friday.

text.p: Slovakia's largest commercial bank Vseobecna Uverova Banka (VUB) a.s. held its annual shareholders meeting on Wednesday and said it would make its 1996 results public on Friday.
Bank officials would make no comment on the outcome of the AGM, which was expected to approve the 1996 results.
VUB posted an after-tax loss of 1.315 billion crowns in the first three quarters of 1996, compared with a 2.187 billion crown profit in the same period last year.
The bank started loan portfolio restructuring last year which, it said, was the main factor behind the loss.

VUB accounts for about one third of company loans in the country. The bank said last year that its swing to loss in January-September period in 1996 was due mainly to accounting changes which attempt "to minimalise accounting interest on arrears which could become irredeemable claims".
It added that it had not accounted for revenue from classified loans.
VUB, which is controlled by the state through a majority stake held by the state National Property Fund, the privatisation agency, is one of three largest Slovak banks still awaiting privatisation,.
VUB shares are listed on the main floor of the Bratislava Stock Exchange (BSE). The stock did not trade on Tuesday after closing at 1,450 crowns on Monday.
